intro: Chorizanthe vaginata var. maritima, commonly known as saltbush or maritime saltbush, is a flowering plant native to coastal areas of North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in arid environments. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in sandy or saline soils and is often found in dunes or along the edges of salt marshes. This variety is adapted to withstand harsh coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds.
